title: Tech sector leads U.S. stocks lower following soft Amazon, Apple results
text:
Microsoft eclipses Apple as largest U.S. company for first time in nearly 16 months

Microsoft Corp. is set to overtake Apple Inc. as the most valuable U.S. company for the first time in nearly 16 months after the smartphone giant reported a rare sales miss in the face of supply constraints. See full story.

How does Biden's latest plan to tax the superrich work? ‘It's more straightforward.'

Surtaxes on multi-millionaires would help generate $230 billion in revenue, according to the White House See full story.

Facebook becomes Meta in rebranding seen as ‘an attempt at distraction'

Meta is the new name for Facebook Inc. A Facebook spokesperson told MarketWatch the stock will start trading under a new ticker symbol it has reserved, MVRS, starting Dec. 1. See full story.

Here's the math for what it takes for Tesla to become the Apple of car makers

Apple crushed the once-dominant handset makers and has fat margins. Can Tesla do the same in automaking? See full story.

MARKETWATCH PERSONAL FINANCE

Surtaxes on multi-millionaires would help generate $230 billion in revenue, according to the White House See full story.
